articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Iceland
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Iceland
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 3 sent a congratulatory message to Olafur Ragnar Grimsson on his reelection as president of Iceland. 
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, Kim Yong Nam wished the president success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the Icelandic people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sao Tome and Principe
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president of Sao Tome and Principe, on the 37th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the republic. 
					 Kim, in the message, expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations will develop in line with the desire of the two peoples.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Hosts Reception to Mark Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception to Mark Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese ambassador to the DPRK gave a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Wednesday on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance between the DPRK and China.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					 Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials attended.
					
					 Liu Hongcai said in his speech that it served as a foundation for developing the bilateral relations that Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung inked the treaty.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the two countries have cooperated with each other in various fields including politics, economy and culture supporting each other on the principle of the treaty and in its spirit.
					
					 He expressed the will of the party and government of China to propel the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation.
					
					 Choe Chang Sik said in his speech that 51 years ago, President Kim Il Sung together with Premier Zhou Enlai provided a legal foundation for comprehensively developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. 
					
					 It was the last instructions of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and a consistent stand of the WPK and the DPRK government to boost the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations, he said.
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship will steadily develop generation after generation as there is the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Chinese consul general in Chongjin hosted a reception on Tuesday.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty Marked
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Beijing hosted a reception on July 9 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance between the DPRK and China.
					 Present there on invitation were Bai Lichen, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Peng Kaizhou, vice-minister of Railways, Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, Yang Yanyi, assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Community Party of China, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Ambassador Ji Jae Ryong and staff member of the DPRK embassy in Beijing were present there.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Ji Jae Ryong recalled that President Kim Il Sung and Premier Zhou Enlai signed the treaty 51 years ago, laying a solid legal foundation for steadily boosting the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional DPRK-China friendship would continue to develop in different fields thanks to the bilateral efforts as intended by the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Bai Lichen referred to the distinguished contribution made by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the development of the DPRK-China friendship in his lifetime, noting he is rejoiced over the fact that the dear respected Kim Jong Un carries forward the tradition of the friendship.
					
					 He affirmed that China will as ever develop through generations the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations together with the Korean comrades in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation and provide the two countries and peoples with greater happiness.

articles.title: Cambodian Official Praises Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Cambodian Official Praises Friendly Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Yim Nolla, senior minister of Cambodia, who visited the DPRK said that the friendly and cooperative relations between Cambodia and the DPRK have an excellent tradition. 
					 The traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries were forged by respected H.M. Great King Norodom Sihanouk and H.E. great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, he said, and went on:
					
					 The fraternal relations of friendship between the two countries have long historical roots. 
					
					 H.E. Generalissimo Kim Il Sung gave moral and material help to the national liberation struggle of the Cambodian people.
					
					 H.E. Generalissimo Kim Jong Il also sent support and solidarity to the just cause of Cambodia. 
					
					 The Cambodian government and people remember this and express heart-felt thanks for this. 
					
					 H.E. dear respected Kim Jong Un pays close attention to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 We will make efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in different fields in the future, too.

articles.title: World Population Day Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
World Population Day Marked in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Various activities on the theme set by the United Nations Population Fund (UNPF) have taken place in DPRK to mark World Population Day.
					 A seminar on ensuring services for reproductive health took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club here on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health, ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations and members of missions of the United Nations Development Program (UNDP) and UNPF.
					
					 The seminar was followed by a briefing on the theme of World Population Day in 2012 and presentation on services for reproductive health in the DPRK and experience in services for reproductive health and for family planning, etc.
					
					 Introduced were achievements and experience gained in the work to fully improve the reproductive health and future orientation of action.
					
					 It was followed by a quiz on common knowledge of reproductive health.
					
					 The Population Centre of the DPRK issued a special edition of "Population Newsletter" and conducted various activities to mark the day.

articles.title: Heavy Rain Hits Some Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Heavy Rain Hits Some Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains, interwoven with strong wind, hit some east and west coastal areas of the DPRK from Tuesday afternoon to Wednesday dawn, affected by low pressure crossing the central area of Korea.
					 122 mm rainfall was registered in Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province, 104 mm in Jangyon County, South Hwanghae Province and 100 mm in Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 On Wednesday 61 mm downpour fell in Sinuiju City from 00:00 to 03:00 and 74 mm in Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province, and 59 mm in Chonnae County, Kangwon Province from 03:00 to 06:00.
					
					 A wind measuring 12 meters per second swept Onchon County of Nampho Municipality and Thaethan and Kwail counties of South Hwanghae Province.

articles.title: 9-Year-Old Boy Sacrifices Himself to Save Two Girls
articles.content:
9-Year-Old Boy Sacrifices Himself to Save Two Girls
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Jo Hyok Chol, a member of the Korean Children's Union and pupil at the fourth grade of Rinsan Primary School in Rinsan County, North Hwanghae Province of the DPRK, sacrificed himself to save two drowning girls. The news touched the heartstrings of people. 
					 On the evening of July 8, he found two girls drowning in the deep waters of the Mungu River. 
					
					 He immediately jumped into the water to save Ri Hyon Ju, second grade girl of the same school. Then he again went back to save Sim Yong Sun, first grade girl of Rinsan Secondary School. He was so exhausted that he could not rise up again after pushing Sim Yong Sun out of water. 
					
					 Teachers, parents of the two girls and residents of the county were deeply moved by the boy's deed and said that his devotion is a revelation of the noble spiritual world of members of the Korean Children's Union proudly growing up to be masters of future and pillars of the country under the care of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Youth and Students in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Youth and Students in Japan Arrives
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Korean youth and students in Japan headed by Kim Yong Ju, a department director of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, arrived in Pyongyang by air on Wednesday to visit socialist homeland.

articles.title: Rakdong River-Crossing Operation Staged in Korean War
articles.content:
Rakdong River-Crossing Operation Staged in Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Rakdong River-crossing operation was one of many successful operations staged by the Korean People's Army during the Korean War (1950-1953).
					 It was conducted by KPA large combined units from August 31 to September 1, 1950.
					
					 At that time the U.S. imperialist forces were driven to Pusan, giving up most areas of south Korea, by continued attacks of the KPA. They amassed huge military forces of Britain and south Korea as well as their troops and reinforced warplanes, tanks and artillery pieces in the area while escalating the shelling and bombing on the KPA positions.
					
					 Under the situation, President Kim Il Sung set forth the 5th operational policy for the first stage of war, which was to encircle the enemy's main forces, concentrated in the narrow area across the River Rakdong, in two directions, wipe them out and destroy the "Pusan base". 
					
					 According his policy, the KPA soldiers made full preparations for crossing the river and launched the crossing operation on August 31, with dummy crossing and attack at left and right wings.
					
					 At the right wing a KPA combined unit went over to an attack on the enemy after its artillery fire and at the left wing another unit started a dummy crossing to lure the enemy.
					
					 The KPA soldiers forced their way through the enemy's defense line along the river under a shower of shells and bombs. A KPA unit crossed the river by use of two fording and landing places at 22:00. Another unit successfully finished its crossing by 23:30 after dispatching an advance party to occupy a crossing point.
					
					 Then followed the crossing by KPA combined units at the second echelon on September 1. After all, the river-crossing operation was completed overnight.
					
					 The successful operation was a victory of Kim Il Sung's prominent strategy, tactics and commanding art and a demonstration of the KPA soldiers' spirit of unconditionally implementing their supreme commander's order.

articles.title: Massacres of Civilians by GIs in Korean War
articles.content:
Massacres of Civilians by GIs in Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Rogun-ri, Yongdong County in North Chungchong Province is one of the witnesses testifying to massacres of civilians by U.S. aggressors during the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953).
					 Walker, the then commander of the U.S. 8th Army, instructed his soldiers to kill at random all Koreans whoever they were.
					
					 Ra Yong Sun, deputy director of the Academic Research Department of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, told KCNA:
					
					 At that time the U.S. Defense Department distributed to GIs copies of a pamphlet urging them to kill anyone in white clothes in the war. Koreans would usually wear white dresses.
					
					 The truth behind the Rogun-ri massacre was disclosed by AP in September 1999, 49 years after the outbreak of the war.
					
					 According to an AP report, in July 1950 the 7th Regiment of the U.S. 1st Armored Division, on the way of retreat from Taejon, ruthlessly killed more than 400 innocent civilians in Rogun-ri.
					
					 "I begged GIs not to kill me. I cried out that I am not a foe. But they did not stop firing," said a survivor.
					
					 American soldiers, involved in the massacre, confessed that their company commander issued an order of shooting all of them to death, after having communications with a superior.
					
					 A south Korean publication criticized the massacre as "a tragedy even a ghost laments over" and a French newspaper said that "the biggest atrocity in the 20th century was committed by the GIs in Korea."
					
					 AP disclosed the fact that in the early 1970s the United States removed pieces of evidence on the massacre from the spot with technical equipment.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists reportedly murdered more than 1.24 million innocent civilians in south Korea during the war.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Deep Concern to Reproductive Health
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Deep Concern to Reproductive Health
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has taken steps conducive to the protection and improvement of women's reproductive health.
					 The work to protect and promote reproductive health is guaranteed by the Socialist Constitution and other laws, including Public Health Law, Law on the Nursing and Upbringing of Children and Family Law, in the country.
					
					 Under the free healthcare system, women in the DPRK get medical services free of charge before and after delivery.
					
					 Women are exempted from hard labor at worksites and the State takes charge of everything needed to nurse and bring up the children, encouraging women's participation in social activities.
					
					 The government's steps include the strengthening of healthcare service for women based on section doctor system, the paid maternity leave system and the offer of additional benefits to prolific mothers. Also, nutrients are supplied to infants short of breast milk.
					
					 Men are urged to take active part in the work for protecting the health of women and children.
					
					 Central hospitals and provincial maternity hospitals have worked hard to upgrade medical service for pregnant women and nursing mothers.
					
					 Meanwhile, big efforts are directed to disseminating common sense and knowledge of reproductive health through information network and media.
					
					 Yang Song Il, section chief at the Population Centre of the DPRK, told KCNA:
					
					 "Assistance and investment in reproductive health grow under the special care of the government.
					
					 The centre is stepping up cooperation with local bodies and international organizations, including the United Nations Population Fund (UNPF), World Health Organization (WHO), United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) and the World Food Programme, to implement the 2011-2015 strategy on reproductive health."
					
					 A seminar was held in Pyongyang on the theme of "World Population Day (July 11)-Universal Access to RH Service" set by UNPF and the centre published a special bulletin on the occasion.

articles.title: S. Korea-Japan Military Tie-ups under Criticism: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korea-Japan Military Tie-ups under Criticism: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers staged a joint naval drill with the United States with the involvement of Japan's "Self-Defence Forces" for the first time in the southern waters off Jeju Island in June.
					 Simultaneously, they contemplated concluding the General Security of Military Information Agreement with Japan.
					
					 A bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Wednesday brands the south Korean warmongers' moves as reckless ones unprecedented since the end of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 The article also calls them very adventurous crimes that allow Japanese reactionaries to pave the way for staging a comeback to Korea and jeopardize the destiny of the nation.
					
					 The article says as follows to disclose the danger of the south Korean warmongers' moves:
					
					 The act of the Lee Myung Bak group of helping Japan whet sword for reinvasion is a height of treachery beyond imagination.
					
					 The reckless moves of the pro-Japanese traitors left the dignity and interests of the Korean nation violated and allowed Japan to revive militarism to stage a comeback to Korea under the sun flag.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries pinpointed the Korean Peninsula as a springboard for realizing their ambition for the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" and have attempted to launch reinvasion after Japan's defeat in World War II. Their moves have become more undisguised in recent years.
					
					 Japan has tried to stretch the tentacles of the "SDF" to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group, being aware of this, has committed itself to concluding the military agreement with Japan, a very dangerous act that ruins the destiny of the nation.
					
					 The situation proves that the Lee group schemes to ignite a war against the DPRK under the pretext of "coping with provocations" and draw the U.S. and Japanese aggression forces into hurting its fellow countrymen.
					
					 The Lee group intends to realize its long-cherished ambition for invading the DPRK counting on outside forces and drum up support from its masters to maintain its power. But its reckless moves can never be tolerated.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan's Intention to Sign GSOMIA
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan's Intention to Sign GSOMIA
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries were disclosed to have made an earnest attempt to sign the General Security of Military Information Agreement (GSOMIA) with south Korea, sparking off public furor.
					 Under the agreement, Japan is to get military information about the DPRK from south Korea with ease and offer its third-rate data to south Korea.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Through the agreement the Japanese militarists seek to pave the way for reinvasion of Korea and lay a foundation for putting the whole Korean Peninsula under their control by using the south Korean puppet forces as a guide.
					
					 The ultimate aim sought by the Japanese reactionaries is to stage a comeback to Asia and further dominate the world.
					
					 The first target of their attack is the DPRK. Japan is working hard to expand the operational sphere of Aegis equipped with interceptor missiles even to the east and west seas of Korea. It is contemplating staging a comeback to Korea on the basis of acquiring military information.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to lay a springboard for launching military reinvasion of Korea at any cost together with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors steeped in hostility toward the DPRK to the marrow of its bones. This renders the situation on the Korean Peninsula extremely tense.
					
					 Military aggression is not a way out for Japan. It will invite self-destruction.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better behave themselves with reason, not pushing the situation to the worst phase.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blames S. Korean Regime for Mounting Tension on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blames S. Korean Regime for Mounting Tension on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea recently said that the north intentionally provoked the sinking of warship "Cheonan" and the Yonphyong Island shelling and pledged to make tens-fold revenge in the event of further provocation. His remark is aimed to cover up the truth behind the massive provocations and shift the responsibility for the north-south relations that plunged to new low following the incidents onto the DPRK and justify his moves for confrontation and war. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The "Cheonan" sinking was not an accidental one but a hideous farce orchestrated by the Lee group to escalate confrontation with the fellow countrymen, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The Lee group is nowadays driving the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war by waging provocative war gambles, while reeling off invectives about "provocations by the north". This aims at misleading public opinion to divert elsewhere the people's hatred against him and tide over the worst ruling crisis. 
					
					 His reckless remark is also aimed at inciting a war to aggravate the north-south confrontation and provoke a new armed conflict as a way out. 
					
					 The situation of the Korean Peninsula is getting more serious and the danger of war is increasing owing to the Lee group's confrontation and war moves. This proves the Lee group is an arch criminal aggravating tension of the peninsula.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses Japan's Intention in Expanded Military Activities in Oceans
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses Japan's Intention in Expanded Military Activities in Oceans 
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Japan sent warships to the U.S.-led RIMPAC joint military maneuvers that were kicked off in Hawaii and its surrounding waters on June 29.
					 On June 5 Japan sent three warships to the Philippines and on June 22 an oceanic trial fleet of the maritime "Self-Defense Force" entered the port in Mumbai, India, under the signboard of "friendly visit and joint drill".
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in this regard in a bylined commentary:
					
					 Japan's expansion of its military activities in the oceans is aimed to hold military hegemony in the Asia-Pacific region and become the "leader" of Asia.
					
					 The United States has to count on the potentials of its allies in the Asia-Pacific region if it is to hold military hegemony over it. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries calculated if they take advantages of it, they can create conditions favorable to carrying out its militarist strategy of overseas aggression.
					
					 So Japan, as demanded by the U.S., is taking part in the joint military maneuvers involving the U.S. and south Korea, while pressing for the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement with south Korea.
					
					 Japan's participation in the maneuvers and its effort to boost military cooperation and exchange with Pacific nations are aimed at seizing  "control" on major sea routes of the Pacific and ensuring the overseas military activities of its "SDF" in case of contingency.
					
					 Japan also seeks to establish a "fresh Asia order" controlled by it by containing its rivals.
					
					 Its indiscreet moves of intensifying military activities in the Asia-Pacific region have increased the risk of confrontation and conflict in the region.
					
					 Japan's ambition for reinvasion is as foolish as lifting an ax to drop it on its own foot.

articles.title: DPRK People Seized by Hatred for S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
DPRK People Seized by Hatred for S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea had already declared that it would react to any insult to the dignity of its supreme leadership with merciless retaliation.
					 Nevertheless, the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea egged a handful of human dregs on to desecrate the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership again when Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, was going back to south Korea after his visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The people in the DPRK are now getting enraged at such provocation.
					
					 Thae Nam Guk, a soldier of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 "The traitors' anti-DPRK hysteria has gone to the extremes.
					
					 It is high time that we, servicepersons, showed our surging anger in action.
					
					 I will knock to pieces the head of rattish Myung Bak with my fist and throw it into the ditch of Chongwadae.
					
					 His henchmen, too, will be bayoneted by our soldiers."
					
					 Ko Hyon Suk, a saleswoman of the Phyongchon District Direct Sales Shop in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "Voices of hatred toward the Lee Myung Bak clan can be heard from among customers.
					
					 Those who buy axes say they would like to cut off Lee's windpipe with them. I think what they say is just public sentiment."

articles.title: Military Agreement with Japan Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Military Agreement with Japan Opposed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations in south Korea held a rally in Seoul on July 7 in protest against the attempted conclusion of a military agreement with Japan.
					 They included the Solidarity for Progress, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification.
					
					 Speakers at the rally said that military guidelines are expected to be released in the wake of the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement and the Agreement on Mutual Logistic Support.
					
					 This will be, in fact, a declaration of the emergence of south Korea-Japanese paramilitary alliance, they said, adding it will also help upgrade the status of the "Self-Defence Forces" to that of an army and draw Japan into solving the issue of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 They urged Lee Myung Bak, little different from Ri Wan Yong, one of the five traitors of 1905, to immediately step down.
					
					 They also called on Park Geun Hye and the "Saenuri Party" to take responsibility for the present situation.
					
					  A resolution was read out at the end of the rally representing a will to fight it out to get the military agreement withdrawn.

articles.title: Korean Students in China Stage DPRK's Opera "The Flower Girl"
articles.content:
Korean Students in China Stage DPRK's Opera "The Flower Girl" 
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- A secondary school of China staged the DPRK's revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl".
					 The Korean school in Tonghua City, Jilin Province recently decided to portray the opera in an aim to instill the idea of the revolutionary opera in the minds of the students and further improve their Korean language education.
					
					 The school succeeded in getting the opera prepared in two months thanks to the instructions of teachers and the active rehearsal of students.
					
					 A few days ago, the revolutionary opera was staged at the school.
					
					 The opera was enjoyed by the teachers and students of the school and members of the association of old people in the city and many others.
					
					 Through the tragic life of heroine Kkotpuni's family, the performers vividly showed with their truthful acting the sufferings of the ruined nation and the miserable fate of the people who groaned under the oppression by the exploiting class.
					
					 The Chinese Jilin Paper on July 5 said the performance of opera served as another means of making the people not to forget the past and helping the students feel the worth of today's happiness.

articles.title: Koreans in China, Russia Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Koreans in China, Russia Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China on July 8 presented floral baskets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at Yuwen Middle School in Jilin and paid tribute to him on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 Attending it were Koreans in China including Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the General Association of Koreans in China, members of the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang and branch offices in China and officials of Jilin Yuwen Middle School.
					
					 Officials of the Liaoning Regional Association and Shenyang branch of the General Association of Koreans in China and other Korean compatriots paid floral tribute to the President's portrait in the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang on the same day.
					
					 Officials of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association visited the DPRK embassy in Beijing to pay floral tribute to his portrait.
					
					 The vice chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, the chairman of the Koreans' Autonomous Society for National Culture in Nakhodka and the chairman of the Autonomous Society for Korean National Culture in Partizansk City and other Korean compatriots in Russia visited the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka on July 7 to lay floral baskets before a full length portrait of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il standing together on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Officials of the Khabarovsk Territory United Confederation of Koreans presented bouquets to the full length portrait of the President and Kim Jong Il at the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk and made a bow.

articles.title: Young Koreans in China Denounce S. Korean Regime for Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Young Koreans in China Denounce S. Korean Regime for Human Rights Abuses 
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Young Koreans in China made public a statement on July 6 in denunciation of the south Korean regime for tempting and abducting residents of the DPRK and committing human rights abuses against them. 
					 The statement said Pak Jong Suk came back to the DPRK recently, disillusioned at south Korean society, adding she was taken away to south Korea by south Korean agents. 
					
					 With her return to the DPRK, the base temptation, abduction and human rights abuses perpetrated against citizens of the DPRK were fully disclosed, the statement said.
					
					 It is only the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea that tempts or abducts citizens of the DPRK in broad daylight even in foreign countries and unhesitatingly uses them for meeting its sinister political purposes while treating them as slaves, it added. 
					
					 It demanded the Lee group immediately stop human rights abuses and make an apology.

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Observe Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Observe Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held a meeting on July 8 to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were Ju Yong Il, chairman of the Association of Elders for Korean Cultural Tradition, and other Koreans in Uzbekistan.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the portrait of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the DPRK embassy in Tashkent and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Ju Yong Il in a speech said that the President always showed deep loving care for overseas Koreans, adding he could never forget the kind-looking image and noble virtue of the President who used to receive compatriots visiting the homeland.
					
					 Ju expressed belief that the cause of building a thriving nation and reunifying the country will surely be achieved thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un identical to the President.
					
					 The participants looked round photos showing the immortal revolutionary career of the President and watched a Korean film dealing with his great revolutionary life.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Demo Held outside U.S. Embassy in UK
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Demo Held outside U.S. Embassy in UK
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- British people held an anti-U.S. demonstration outside the U.S. embassy in London on June 25 to mark the beginning the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Present there were Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, Dermot Hudson, chief of the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association and chairman of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other British figures of political parties and organizations and citizens.
					
					 The demonstrators condemned the U.S. imperialists' hostile policy toward the DPRK and their moves to ignite a new war, waving the flags of the DPRK.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. withdraw its forces for aggression from south Korea and replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace accord in order to ensure the lasting peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 They also lashed out at the U.S. for going reckless in its anti-DPRK smear campaign while pulling up the DPRK over the "human rights" issue and getting hell-bent on the war games against the DPRK in collaboration with the south Korean puppet regime.
					
					 The demonstrators expressed full support for the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Serbians Rap U.S. and S. Korea for Anti-DPRK Provocations
articles.content:
Serbians Rap U.S. and S. Korea for Anti-DPRK Provocations
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Serbian figures released a joint statement on July 3 denouncing the U.S. for committing more provocations against the DPRK.
					 Among them were the general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia and the international secretary of the Central Committee of the League of the Yugoslav Communist Youth.
					
					 The statement said the U.S. imperialist aggression forces present in south Korea recently dared fire at the flag of the DPRK, the most serious political and military provocation, while staging the largest-ever joint live-shell firing drill in the area south of the Demilitarized Zone together with the south Korean puppet armed forces.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 It is a vivid expression of their hostile policy towards the DPRK that they targeted the flag of the DPRK, symbol of its sovereignty and dignity of the Korean nation.
					
					 Historically, the U.S. has been the worst criminal state as it violated democracy, peace and stability, splitting other nations and fostering racism worldwide.
					
					 The reckless aggression on the part of the imperialists will never stem the struggle of the revolutionaries for just cause.
					
					 The statement expressed the firm pledge of the Party and League to fully support the Korean people in their struggle against imperialism.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully", part of President Kim Il Sung's work "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee", came off press in pamphlet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on July 5.
					 This part of the work made public on October 10, 1980 deals with the efforts the Workers' Party of Korea made for national reunification during the period under review, and indicates the tasks to be fulfilled for independent peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It also clarifies the new proposal for reunification to establish the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) on the basis of the Three Principles of National Reunification and the 10-point policy to be pursued by the DFRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepali Paper
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was carried by the Nepali paper Weekly Mirror on July 6.
					 The work, published on August 4, 1997, deals with the undying feats President Kim Il Sung performed for national reunification and indicates tasks and ways for accomplishing the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The paper carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Democratic Congolese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Democratic Congolese Paper
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" was carried by the Democratic Congolese paper L'Avenir on July 3.
					 The work, published on April 20, 2012, deals with revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and clarifies the tasks for resolutely defending and adhering to their idea and feats for all ages.

articles.title: Benin Group for Study of Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism Formed
articles.content:
Benin Group for Study of Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism Formed
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism was formed on June 19 as an affiliated group to the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea. The formation was occasioned by the 48th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Pascal Zouncheme, rector of the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin, was elected chief of the Group.
					
					 The rector said it is the greatest honor and fortune to form President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's namesake study group. He stressed for more deeply studying and widely disseminating Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism in the future.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Russia, India, Bulgaria and Denmark between July 4 and 5 to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia praised the President as an outstanding military activist and a genius of creation and construction who wisely led the Korean people in their heroic struggle for freedom and independence of the country.
					
					 His life was dedicated to the people's happiness and national reunification, she added.
					
					 Noting the President's was the life of the great father, the secretary general of the Indian Society for Juche-Idea-Self-Reliance Studies said it was the President's lifetime motto to find himself among the people.
					
					 He started his revolutionary activities by finding himself among the people, led the revolution to victory by mobilizing the popular masses and summed up his revolutionary career among the people.
					
					 The acting manager of Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, Bulgaria, said the President is always living in the hearts of the world people for his great exploits.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Finnish Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Finnish Political Figure
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's idea and cause serve as an inspiring banner for not only the Korean people but the world progressive people.
					 Hannu Harju, chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, said this in his statement on July 5.
					
					 The President dedicated all his life to the struggle for freedom and emancipation of the Korean people, he noted, adding:
					
					 By waging an anti-Japanese armed struggle he brought about the liberation of the country, led to victory the Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. invaders with his gifted strategy. He thus enjoyed boundless reverence from the Korean people as great leader and iron-willed brilliant commander.
					
					 He defeated two imperialisms in one generation, wisely led the building of socialism after the war and built a powerful independent country in Korea.
					
					 The Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism expresses belief that under the wise guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un the Workers' Party of Korea would provide the Korean people with brighter future and a happier life by thoroughly carrying out the behests of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Papers of various countries carried special write-ups to commemorate the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on July 3 dedicated one whole page to the special write-up illustrated with a portrait of  smiling Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Lasting reverence" praised the President as a great man who enjoyed deep reverence from the world people century after century, age after age.
					
					 The paper elaborated on significant celebrations of the centenary of his birth in the DPRK and foreign countries in April.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Ekota on July 4 in an article titled "Great man of century" lauded the undying feats the President performed by founding the Juche idea and clearly indicating the road to be followed by humankind.
					
					 His exploits of illuminating the way of the humankind for independence and progress will shine long, it added.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on July 2 carried an article introducing the leadership feats of the President who conducted energetic activities for the liberation of the country and the happiness of its people.
					
					 The banner of independence held aloft by the President is becoming a great engine instilling strength and courage into the Korean people and the progressive people throughout the world, the paper added.

articles.title: Medvedev's Visit to Kunashiri Fuels Friction with Japan
articles.content:
Medvedev's Visit to Kunashiri Fuels Friction with Japan
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Disputes between Russia and Japan are getting acute over the issue of dominium over the south Kuril Islands, occasioned by the Russian prime minister's recent visit to Kunashiri Island.
					 On July 3 Medvedev visited the Island with several senior government officials including the vice prime minister.
					
					 It was his second drop after the one made in November 2011 in his former capacity as the head of state.
					
					 Medvedev, going round commercial service facilities, underscored the need to keep pushing forward the socio-economic development plan of the southern Kurils, after learning about harbor construction.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, the authorities of the Japanese government including the chief Cabinet secretary blamed it as an act of throwing cold water on the recent positive atmosphere between the two countries, and the Japan Foreign Ministry summoned the Russian ambassador in Tokyo to lodge protest against it.
					
					 Commenting on this, the vice chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the Russian Federal Assembly in an interview strongly rejected it as an intolerable interference in the country's internal affairs. He asserted that the southern Kurils belong to Russia, urging Japanese politicians to recall their country's unconditional surrender in World War II.
					
					 As known, Japan and Russia have long been engaged in the territorial disputes over Etorofu, Kunashiri, Shikotan and Habomai, four islands of the Kurils.
					
					 As a result of World War II, the former Soviet Union grabbed the whole of the archipelago under the agreement of big powers on postwar handling of defeated countries. And Japan, in September 1951 officially declared at San Francisco conference that it gives up dominium over the archipelago.
					
					 Japan, however, denying this historical fact, has persistently claimed the Kurils raising unreasonable allegations that the archipelago mentioned in the San Francisco Peace Treaty did not include the disputed four islands.
					
					 Russia reiterated its stand never to compromise as regards the Kurils.
					
					 Medvedev, during his recent visit, pointed out that he "will not concede even an inch of the Russian territory", reaffirming his will to firmly maintain the country's territorial right over the four controversial islands.
					
					 He at a press conference in Kamchatka Territory on July 5, referring to Japan's feedback over his visit to Kunashiri Island, said with irony that "I have no interest in Japan's response. So I don't want to waste my time answering such questions."
					
					 Analysts expect Russian-Japanese stand-off and friction escalating again over the Kurils' issue will badly influence the overall bilateral relations.

articles.title: Japan's Acts of Toeing U.S. Policy Slammed
articles.content:
Japan's Acts of Toeing U.S. Policy Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities' stand of toeing the U.S. policy has touched off bitter criticism and resentment at home and abroad.
					 The Japan minister of Defense recently toured Yamaguchi and Okinawa prefectures to persuade the residents and request the local authorities to allow the delivery of MV-22 Osprey to these prefectures. 
					
					 As known, the U.S. envisions the temporary deployment of MV-22 Osprey in the Iwaguni base of Yamaguchi Prefecture and then its transfer to the Futenma base of Okinawa Prefecture.
					
					 The Japanese authorities, who are obedient to the U.S., readily accepted its plan only to be in trouble.
					
					 The recent crash of MV-22 Osprey in Morocco caused a strong opposition of residents in various prefectures including Okinawa Prefecture to the deployment of the U.S. transport plane.
					
					 It is not likely that the Japanese, who had been exposed to sufferings like noise and air pollution, would accept the crash-prone airplane. 
					
					 Much upset by this development, the Japanese government let the minister of Defense tour prefectures to make the residents change their minds, complaining that it is difficult to change the decision that had already been made.
					
					 The minister met with the governors and mayors of the prefectures and requested them to make a concession, saying that "social concerns are fully understandable".
					
					 He parroted U.S. military which said that it would impose flight ban in the sky above Japan until the security of the transport planes is guaranteed.
					
					 This drew disillusion of the local authorities as he followed the U.S. sinister intention to bring the transport planes to the land of Japan.
					
					 The governor of Okinawa Prefecture, when meeting the minister of Defense, strongly rejected the U.S. deployment plan in the prefecture.
					
					 If the push given by the U.S. for the deployment results in any accident, he will be compelled to demand the U.S. forces immediately withdraw all the military bases from Okinawa, the governor said.
					
					 The mayor of Ginowan City of Okinawa Prefecture and the mayor of Iwaguni City of Yamaguchi Prefecture stressed that they can not accept the deployment plan, urging the minister of Defense to make U.S. cancel the plan. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Okinawa Prefectural Assembly and the Iwaguni City Assembly of Yamaguchi Prefecture unanimously adopted a resolution and a written opinion calling for withdrawing the plan. 
					
					 Amid voices calling for opening prefectural meetings to protest the authorities and the U.S. government growing stronger in different parts of Japan, a ship with MV-22 Osprey on board left the U.S. naval base in California for Japan, Kyodo said.
					
					 Analysts see that if the Japanese authorities keep turning their back on the people, not departing from the bad habit of toeing the U.S. policy, they will face self-isolation.

articles.title: Cuba Raps U.S. Plan against Cuba
articles.content:
Cuba Raps U.S. Plan against Cuba
 Havana, July 10 (KCNA) -- Ricardo Alarcon, president of the National Assembly of the People's Power of Cuba, chided the U.S. for its plan against Cuba on July 6.
					 U.S. President Barack Obama continues implementing the plan of his predecessor George W. Bush to destabilize the political system in Cuba, said Alarcon, adding that the U.S. administration decided to allocate an additional 20 million USD to the funds the U.S. uses to try to undermine the Cuban society.
					
					 He accused the U.S. of mulling setting up in Cuba an unpopular political system utterly ignorant of the popular masses' role.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Manuel Pinto Da Costa
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Manuel Pinto Da Costa
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 37o aniversario de proclamacion de la independencia y de la Republica de Sao Tome Principe, Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 11 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de ese pais Manuel Pinto Da Costa.
					En su misiva, el remitente manifesto su conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran conforme a la aspiracion y deseo de ambos pueblos las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Traidores a la nacion tendran fin tragico: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
Traidores a la nacion tendran fin tragico: comentario de ACN
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- La reiterada difamacion de la maxima dignidad nacional por parte de la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak provoca la vehemente indignacion de todos los connacionales.
					La fiebre conflictiva con la RPDC de ellos ha llegado al climax con motivo del regreso via Phanmunjom del vicepresidente de la direccion surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria, Ro Su Hui.
					
					Organizaron el dia 5 el llamado "mitin de denuncia" al paralelo del arresto de Ro Su Hui y cometieron la locura de calumniar la dignidad de la Direccion Suprema de la RPDC.
					
					De esta manera, los titeres surcoreanos expusieron otra vez a la vista del mundo su naturaleza de fanaticos de enfrentamiento y corruptos inmorales e incorregibles.
					
					En el presente incidente, ellos mostraron por si solos que tienen panico al inimaginable poderio del Songun de la RPDC.
					
					Los esfuerzos desesperados de ese punado de miserables, abandonado por la nacion producen el efecto contrario de centuplicar la confianza en la justeza de idea, causa y regimen y la victoria final de ella.
					
					Gracias a tener a los grandes Hombres del monte Paektu, la RPDC llego a ostentar el poderio de un  Estado centrado en las masas populares que garantiza la dignidad y vida independiente de las masas populares trabajadoras.
					
					Ademas, se prepararon el programa comun para la reunificacion nacional para la reconciliacion, la unidad y reintegracion territorial, gracias a lo cual se abre su brillante perspectiva.
					
					Los traidores a la nacion y las escorias humanas no toman en consideracion la dignidad ni el futuro de la nacion y les interesan unicamente el dinero y su sucia vida de felonias.
					
					El traidor Lee se opone obstinadamente a la unidad y coprosperidad con los connacionales y se dedica a las maldades contra ellos.
					
					Es una verguenza de la nacion coreana que ese tipejo existiera todavia entre los coreanos.
					
					El traidor Lee Myung Bak debe darse cuenta de que estara fuera de la imaginacion la batalla de la nacion coreana para liquidarlos.

articles.title: Reportan muchas precipitaciones en algunas zonas de Corea
articles.content:
Reportan muchas precipitaciones en algunas zonas de Corea
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- Por la influencia de la baja presion atmosferica que atraviesa la zona central de Corea, desde la tarde del dia 10 hasta la madrugada del dia siguiente, cayeron muchas lluvias acompanadas de turbonada en algunas regiones de las costas oriental y occidental.
					Las precitaciones marcaron 122mm en la ciudad de Sinuiju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, 104mm en el distrito de Jangyon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur y 100mm en el distrito de Kowon de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					Entre la hora 0 y las 3 del dia 11, las lluvias torrenciales se acumularon en 61mm en la ciudad de Sinuiju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Desde las 3 hasta las 6 del mismo dia, se registraron 74mm y 59mm en el distrito de Kowon de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur y el distrito de Chonnae de la provincia de Kangwon, respectivamente.
					
					En el distrito de Onchon de la ciudad de Nampho y los distritos de Thaethan y Kwail de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur se hizo un fuerte viento con una velocidad mayor de 12m/s.
